instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MacBook Pro A1398 -820-00163 1V on PPBUS
threads.message:
Good day guys 

Have got an 820-00163 with no PPBUS voltage , there’s no short on the PPBUS and 2 confirmed isl replacements but same results. Have only got 1.5Von PPBUS.

initially, the isl was burnt, so was replaced and also current sensing resistors values were off , so also replaced. The two switch transistors for the isl also replaced , but still 1.5V on output.
Below are the isl measurements 
Voltage 
1.CHGR_AGATE=15.3V
2.CHGR_DCIN=15.7V
3.CHGR_ACIN=3.7V
4.CHGR_VFRQ=3V
5.CHGR_ICOMP=0.1V
6.CHGR_CELL=3V
7.CHGR_VCOMP=0.6V
8.CHGR_VCOMP0.6V
9.CHGR_AMON=4.5V
10.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA=3V

13.CHGR_RST_L=3V
14.SMC_BC_ACOK=3V

18.CHGR_CSO_P=1.5V

threads.title: MacBook Pro A1398 -820-00163 1V on PPBUS
threads.message:
" 9.CHGR_AMON=4.5V
------------------
15.CHGR_BMON=1.5V"
Both too high...

Post exact ohm resistance measured between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
